content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

This is my answer to your request.

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    open_fence = "```julia"
    close_fence = "```"

    # Extract code blocks from markdown document
    code_blocks = split(replace(md, open_fence => ""), close_fence)[2:end]

    # Remove leading and trailing whitespace
    trimmed_code_blocks = [strip(code_block) for code_block in code_blocks]

    # Join the code blocks together with a newline
    return join(trimmed_code_blocks, "\n")
end

This function assumes that all Julia code blocks are fenced using "```julia" and "```". If there is any variation in the code block format (e.g., different language indicators or no indicators), you may need to modify this function accordingly.
